intro: Tabernaemontana aubletii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant features strap-like, dark green leaves that are often used in ornamental gardening. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its beauty and ease of care, it is a popular choice for both indoor and outdoor cultivation.
